title: Jury convicts 1 officer in connection with Elijah McClain's death
description: The jury has convicted one officer in the first trial connected to 2019 death of 23-year-old Elijah McClain.

title: Rudolph Isley, founding member of The Isley Brothers, dies at 84
description: Rudolph Isley, a founding member of The Isley Brothers, passed away Wednesday morning at the age of 84.

title: Ohio begins voting on amendment that would guarantee abortion rights
description: Ohio residents this week began voting on a constitutional amendment whose fate will ultimately determine abortion access in the state

title: 17 Florida sheriff's office employees charged with COVID relief fraud: Feds
description: Seventeen people who worked for the Broward County Sheriff's Office are accused by federal prosecutors of taking COVID relief money for themselves.

title: Federal agents in Puerto Rico seize $35 million worth of cocaine
description: Federal agents in Puerto Rico say they have seized an estimated $35 million worth of cocaine from a boat that ran aground a reef off the island's south coast

title: Birkenstock goes public on New York Stock Exchange
description: Birkenstock took its footwear company public at the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday.

title: State Department announces plan to fly Americans out of Israel
description: The White House announced the State Department will start flying out American citizens from Israel starting Friday via chartered flights.

title: US, Qatar agree to prevent Iran from tapping previously frozen $6 billion fund
description: The U.S. has reached an agreement with Qatar to halt the release of $6 billion in Iranian oil assets amid scrutiny over Iran’s relationship with Hamas.

title: Idaho officials briefly order evacuation of small town after gas line explodes
description: Authorities briefly ordered evacuations for most of the town of Middleton, Idaho after a gas line exploded at nearby rural intersection late Thursday morning

title: Palestinian-American family stuck in Gaza despite pleas to US officials
description: The Biden administration says it is seeking safe passage for civilians in Gaza.

title: Florida law targeting drag shows can't be enforced for now, appellate court says
description: A ruling prohibiting the enforcement of a new Florida law targeting drag shows will stay in place for the time being

title: Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez facing additional charges following sweeping indictment
description: Prosecutors filed new charges against Sen. Bob Menendez accusing him of violating a prohibition on members of Congress from acting as an agent of a foreign principal.

title: Social Security benefits will increase by 3.2% in 2024 as inflation moderates
description: It "will help millions of people keep up with expenses," the commissioner said.

title: Blinken meets Hamas attack survivors, pledges US support on trip to Israel
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken pledged unwavering support for Israel during his visit with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Musk's X has taken down hundreds of Hamas-linked accounts, CEO says
description: The head of Elon Musk’s social media platform X says the company formerly known has Twitter has removed hundreds of Hamas-linked accounts and taken down or labeled tens of thousands of pieces of content since the militant group’s attack on Israel

title: Teen faces adult murder charge in slaying of Michigan election canvasser
description: A 15-year-old has been charged as an adult with murder in the death of a Michigan election canvasser he is accused of shooting after asking the worker for a dollar

title: Five officers shot and wounded in Minnesota, authorities say
description: Authorities say five law enforcement officers were shot and wounded in an incident near the east-central Minnesota city of Princeton

title: Stockholm to ban gasoline and diesel cars from downtown commercial area in 2025
description: An official says a ban on gasoline and diesel-fueled cars from a commercial district of Stockholm’s downtown in 2025 will be the first for a European capital

title: Early morning storms leave path of damage from Tampa Bay into north Florida
description: An early morning storm system that moved across parts of Florida left a path of damage to cars, houses and businesses

title: Crane brought in to remove historic tree in England that was cut in act of vandalism
description: A much-loved sycamore tree near the Roman landmark of Hadrian’s Wall in northeastern England that was cut down two weeks ago in an act of vandalism is being removed from the site

title: Thai, Filipino workers filling labor gap in Israel get caught up in war
description: The first group of Thai workers evacuated from Israel after the past few days’ bloody events in southern Israel and Gaza have arrived in Bangkok, greeted by anxious relatives and senior officials

title: The US government sanctions two shipping companies for violating the Russian oil price cap
description: The Treasury Department has imposed its first set of sanctions on two companies that shipped Russian oil in violation of a multinational price cap

title: More than 90% of people killed by Afghanistan quake were women and children, UN says
description: U.N. officials say more than 90% of the people killed by a 6.3-magnitude earthquake in western Afghanistan were women and children

title: Auto workers escalate strike, walking out at largest Ford factory
description: The United Auto Workers union significantly escalated its walkout against Detroit's Three automakers by going on strike Wednesday at the largest and most profitable Ford plant in the world

title: Inflation held steady in September, running hotter than expected
description: Consumer prices rose 3.7% over the year ending in September.

title: US jobless claims remain at historically low 209K, sign of labor market strength
description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits was unchanged last week, remaining at historically low levels in another sign that the U.S. job market remains strong in the face of higher interest rates

title: WATCH:  Drone footage shows destruction at kibbutz attacked by Hamas
description: Drone footage showed destruction, damage and rubble on ground in the Be'eri Kibbutz area in Israel, where Hamas militants left scores dead in an unprecedented attack inside Israel.

title: Former Formula One boss Bernie Ecclestone pleads guilty to fraud
description: Former Formula One boss Bernie Ecclestone has admitted fraud at a court hearing after prosecutors charged him with failing to declare millions of dollars held in a trust in Singapore to Britain’s government

title: Bombarded by Israeli airstrikes, conditions in Gaza grow more dire as power goes out
description: Conditions in Gaza grew even more dire on Wednesday when the only power plant ran out of fuel, leaving the territory with no electricity, officials said.

title: Music festival survivor details escape from Hamas: 'They hunted us for hours'
description: Daniel Levi recounts how she hid in a tree for more than six hours amid the deadly Hamas attack on a music festival where more than 200 people were killed.

title: US aircraft carrier arrives in South Korea
description: A U.S. nuclear-powered aircraft carrier has arrived in South Korea in a demonstration of strength against North Korea

title: New York officer fatally shoots man in fencing mask who charged police with 2 swords
description: A police officer has shot and killed a man who charged at authorities with two swords on New York's Long Island, and the police commissioner says the shooting appears to be justified

title: Strike talks break off between Hollywood actors and studios
description: Strike talks have broken off between Hollywood actors and studios

title: Ticket sold in California wins Powerball jackpot of $1.73 billion
description: Winning Powerball numbers were drawn on Wednesday for $1.73 billion jackpot.

title: Iowa man sentenced to 2 life terms in death of 10-year-old girl whose body was found in a pond
description: An Iowa man has been sentenced to two life terms for killing a 10-year-old girl who was missing for eight months before her remains were found in a pond

title: Black student suspended over his hairstyle to be sent to an alternative education program
description: A Black student who spent more than a month on in-school suspension over his dreadlocks has been told he will be removed from his Texas high school and sent to a disciplinary alternative education program on Thursday

title: The United Autoworkers Union says it is expanding its strike to include 8,700 workers at a Ford truck plant in Kentucky
description: The United Autoworkers Union says it is expanding its strike to include 8,700 workers at a Ford truck plant in Kentucky

title: Man being sued over Mississippi welfare spending files his own suit against the governor
description: One of the people being sued by the Mississippi Department of Human Services over allegations of misspending welfare money has filed a separate lawsuit against Gov. Tate Reeves
